metadata.Title: CVE-2020-8631 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
cloud-init through 19.4 relies on Mersenne Twister for a random password, which makes it easier for attackers to predict passwords, because rand_str in cloudinit/util.py calls the random.choice function.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8631` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cloud-init - 21.4-25-g039c40f9-0ubuntu1~22.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ccdm94> This CVE has been patched in Xenial ESM. The patch, however, has been added only to the updates pocket, and since cloud-init is only used during first boot (pulling from updates), there should not be a need to add this to the security pocket.

criterions.comment: cloud-init package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '21.4-25-g039c40f9-0ubuntu1~22.04.1').
